name: Anantara Veli Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I am a professional photographer and visited the Maldives in mid January. We stayed at 3 different resorts and I must say that Anatara Veli was my favorite because of the AMAZING views. It seemed everywhere you turned was another opportunity to take a great picture. We were also able to visit their sister island, Anatara Dhigu. We noticed that Anatara Veli was definitively more quiet as no children are allowed to stay there. All of the Maldivian islands seem to cater everything toward honeymooners, since there were only king beds in each room. (you could request extra cots if needed). The breakfast buffet was delicious and the staff made you feel really welcome. We apparently arrived at the perfect time (mid January) since it was shortly after the holiday rush period. The entire time on Anatara Veli, it felt like we were the only ones on the island.....so peaceful!
reviews.title: Ridiculously scenic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I returned from spending almost a week in a gorgeous over-water bungalow on Veli Island and it is indeed like a tropical fantasy. The resort has a nice variety of restaurants, as spa, and a little gym, and it is easy to get over to Dhigu to enjoy the spa and restaurants there. While you are in the middle of now-where, the food was without exception outstanding (though expensive) and the staff was utterly amazing. They were kind, attentive, personable, and made us feel special every day. My husband spent alot of time scuba diving and speaks very highly of the diving company and dive masters located on Dhigu. In all, we had a fantastic time and definitely would recommend Veli to couples wanting a calm, romantic, get-away. We spent a few days in Dubai on the way home, which made of a very "varied" trip. Amazing in all ways!!
reviews.title: Beautiful and Gracious Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from 8 days at Veli and it was magnificent! It's a beautiful resort with an incredible attention to detail and service. The entire experience is perfect for honeymooners, although any couple seeking a quiet, high-end vacation will be very pleased. We stayed in the over-water bungalows and loved it. The shower is open and over the coral reef so your morning shampoo includes watching the fish! Our deck looked out to the ocean and each night we would sit outside with a glass of wine and watch the shooting stars. What an experience! I highly recommend the 3-day spa experience; it was a value at $500USD+, and the salt scrub, seaweed wrap and massages were heavenly.
reviews.title: Perfect Location for Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A fabulous breakfast comes with your room and is enough to keep you going until dinner: omelet station, fruit juices, hearty English-style offerings, meat, cheese, Chinese breakfast, waffle bar. The food on Veli is incredibly expensive; $20 for soup! But the food was very good.
reviews.title: Fantasy Indian Ocean Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We participated in the snorkeling trip and village visit. The snorkeling trip was fabulous-you swim around the coral that surrounds a deep ravine. I would pass on the village visit-it was more of a chance for the locals to hit you up for money or insist you buy something from one of their pre-selected stores.
reviews.title: In heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think the experience of staying in a fantastic resort can only be enhanced by one thing: The staff and I think the staff at Anantara Veli is like the cherry on the icing .
reviews.title: No words are enough!

reviews.title: Planning a return 12 hours after leaving !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room also came with a sun deck with a bed to lie on and another lower deck over water from where you could slide in the shoulder high atoll waters. The fishes were swimming just under our room and the view was to die for.
reviews.title: Amazing, Spectacular, Wonderful, Etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good thing about Anantara veli is that only couples stay on the resort so it is bit quiet but you can go over to Dhigu (which is for family as well) for dining/more beach. There are 2 restaurants/ bar in veli and another 3 dining options in Dhigu plus a Thai restaurant. So you would not be bored with the same food again and again. We wee also pleasantly surprised by the in room dining quality and some nights we just ordered the in room dining (on the deck under a spectacular sky filled with stars).
reviews.title: Perfect stay in the Maldives :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anantara is the best chain of hotels in Asia . My first time was in Maldives , where I came for my birthday with my love ! It was the best vacation ever. The stuff was very friendly and helpful ! The hotel was nice all of them were on water which is great view when you are coming to the hotel on a speed boat it looks so amazing ! I took millions pictures if the island , it's great hotel because next to veil there is another one hotel which also has a lot of restaurant and nice pool and great spa ! reviews.title: Great island with awesome rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay two nights on this island and try two room types. Deluxe Water Villa is superb, private bath room which have a top-down window (if you don;t mind) that can see great ocean views. The Coral is just under your villa, so you can dive near your villa and see lots of fishes..Restaurants are all great, especially the Thai restaurants. Great services. Must do is Manta trip. Half hour speed boat and snorkle to see the 4 meters big Manta around you. Amazing!
reviews.title: Honeymoon Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Words simply do not describe this place (as cliche as that sounds, it is merely the truth). My Wife and i traveled here and stayed at the Veli resort for our Honeymoon. The staff, the area, the food (especially Ban Hurra) was beyond our wildest dreams. The beauty of the resort here is that there are 3 islands in which you can hop to via boat that only takes 2 minutes. so you can eat, drink, swim on any of the islands no matter which one you are staying on. We were fortunate to stay on Veli because the other islands were more family orientated. The staff also seemed a little bit more enthusiastic on Veli. This place can be reviewed over and over again, but you truly must see it, to believe it all. Our favorite part of the trip was being able to snorkel right off our over-water bungalow. The snorkel gear is rented for free at the water sports shop and you get to keep it your entire stay. We stayed for 7 nights and couldnt have asked for a better week. We plan on making our journey back across the world to Anantara-Veli some time again!
reviews.title: bliss

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited this resort for six nights over New Year with my son and his fiancé on accommodation and breakfast basis. On arrival we were very impressed with the wonderful welcome we received and with the stunning situation of the resort and adjoining islands which also belonged to the group. The bungalows on stilts were beautifully appointed. They were spacious, well equipped with toiletries, slippers, robes, umbrellas in the event of showers, life jackets, coffee machine, safe, minibar/fridge and to be perfectly honest, nothing was lacking to ensure a perfect stay. Everyone had a personal sundeck, and steps into the lagoon. There was a pontoon running every five minutes to take guests from island to island within the Anantara facility. Gifts of quality Chocolates were given on several occasions. Apart from the natural beauty of this area the other most commendable aspect of this resort was the wonderfully obliging staff who were welcoming, friendly, and willing to go the extra mile to please. I cannot commend these young people more highly if I tried. They worked tirelessly to ensure that our holiday was as perfect as possible and updated us daily to ensure we were aware of what was on offer. There were several types of restaurants to choose from with themed evenings. Not all were up to scratch. We observed at the beginning of our holiday the breakfast buffet was more than adequate with an abundance of everything. A few days down the line, the choice of fruits were limited and less fresh. The pork bacon was only offered twice, then it became chicken or beef bacon. But having said that. there was still a vast array of foods to suit every palate, and if you went hungry it was your own fault. Again the breakfast staff were the most courteous, cheerful, smiling, happy, pleasing, communicative young people. The downside - unfortunately some areas of the resort have become a little tired and in need of upgrading. However this didn't detract from its rustic charm but with its five star rating, expectations were high, especially when prices were five star and more!
reviews.title: Slightly tired, but beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel almost a year ago and had a fantastic experience. The customer service is excellent, food was great and the resort is breathtakingly beautiful. The spa was lovely and so was the breakfast. Highly recommended and can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

aka: Anantara Veli Hotel South Male Atoll
description: Retreat hand-in-hand to one of the most naturally stunning destinations on earth, a romantic paradise enveloped in soft white sands and turquoise waters. Just 20 km by speedboat from the airport in Male, delight in the private luxury of your own over-water bungalow, with all the comforts of home and then some. Unwind in your room, either over water in the crystal lagoon, or from your Ocean Pool Bungalow, with private pool and ocean views offering beach and lagoon access a few minutes stroll from your room, or admire the kaleidoscope of exotic fish and corals just steps from your over water and deluxe over water bungalow.
